sen.j: 隆禅（りゅうぜん、長暦2年（1038年） - 康和2年7月14日 (旧暦)（1100年8月21日））は、平安時代後期の法相宗の僧。
sen.e: Ryuzen (1038 - August 21, 1100) was a Hosso sect Buddhist monk during the latter half of Heian period.
Ryuzen (1038 - August 21, 1100) was a Hosso sect Buddhist monk in the late Heian period.
sen.cmt: ｢平安時代後期」を用語集に沿って直しました。
sen.e: Ryuzen (1038 - August 21, 1100) was a Hosso sect Buddhist monk in the late Heian period.

sen.j: 父は左少将藤原政兼（一説によれば源雅兼ともいう）。
sen.e: His father was Left lieutenant FUJIWARA no Masakane, or according to an opinion, MINAMOTO no Masakane.
His father was FUJIWARA no Masakane, the Sashosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), or according to an opinion, MINAMOTO no Masakane.
sen.cmt: ｢左少将」を用語集に沿って直しました。
sen.e: His father was FUJIWARA no Masakane, the Sashosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), or according to an opinion, MINAMOTO no Masakane.

sen.j: 興福寺南院の円縁僧都に師事して唯識・因明・法相宗教学を学んだ。
sen.e: He studied the doctrines of Yuishiki, Inmyo, and Hosso under Enen sozu of the South hall of Kofukuji Temple.
He studied the doctrines of Yuishiki, Inmyo, and Hosso under Enen sozu of the South hall of Kofukuji Temple.
He studied the doctrines of Yuishiki, Inmyo, and Hosso under Enen sozu of the South hall of Kofukuji Temple.

sen.j: 1073年（延久5年）維摩会の講師をつとめ、1082年（永保2年）に律師に任じられ、以後興福寺別当・法印を経て権大僧都に任じられた。
sen.e: In 1073, he served as an instructor in a Buddhist service 'Yuimae"; In 1082, he was appointed an administrative position Risshi; then served as the chief priest and the highest ranked monk Hoin at Kofukuji Temple; and he was appointed a high-ranked administrative position Gondaisozu.

In 1073, he served as an instructor in a Buddhist service Yuimae, was appointed an administrative position Risshi in 1082, served as the chief priest and the highest ranked monk Hoin at Kofukuji Temple, and was appointed a high-ranked administrative position Gondaisozu.
sen.cmt: セミコロンをコンマに直し、主語をとりました。クオーテーションは、この場合不要と思い、とりました。
sen.e: In 1073, he served as an instructor in a Buddhist service Yuimae, was appointed an administrative position Risshi in 1082, served as the chief priest and the highest ranked monk Hoin at Kofukuji Temple, and was appointed a high-ranked administrative position Gondaisozu.

sen.j: 1087年（寛治元年）興福寺に大乗院を開創して第1世となり、一乗院と並ぶ門跡寺院としての大乗院の礎を築いた。
sen.e: In 10087, he founded Daijoin Temple in Kofukuji Temple and became the first head priest, and laid a foundation for Daijoin Temple as a temple whose chief priest is an Imperial Prince comparable to Ichijoji Temple.

In 1087, he founded Daijoin Temple in Kofukuji Temple to become the first head priest, and laid a foundation for Daijoin Temple as a monzeki temple (a temple of high rank where members of imperial family and nobility enter the priesthood), which was comparable to Ichijoji Temple.
sen.cmt: 「10087｣→「1087」にし、「門跡寺院」を用語集通りの記載にし、comparableの前に「which was｣を挿入しました。また、becameをto becomeとしました。（andが続いてしまうのと、｢～してーする」なのでtoのほうがよいのでは、と思ったからです。）
sen.e: In 1087, he founded Daijoin Temple in Kofukuji Temple to become the first head priest, and laid a foundation for Daijoin Temple as a monzeki temple (a temple of high rank where members of imperial family and nobility enter the priesthood), which was comparable to Ichijoji Temple.

sen.j: 1096年（永長元年）には興福寺権別当に任じられ、大和国長谷寺・大安寺の寺務も兼任していた。
sen.e: In 1096, he was appointed assistant head abbot of Kofukuji Temple, while concurrently serving as official of Hasadera Temple and Daianji Temple in Yamato Province.
In 1096, he was appointed gon no betto (acting chief) of Kofukuji Temple and concurrently served as an official of Hasadera Temple and Daianji Temple in Yamato Province.
sen.cmt: 「権別当」を用語集通りの記載にしました。Officialに冠詞をつけました。While以下をandでつなぎ、「serving」を「served」にしました。
sen.e: In 1096, he was appointed gon no betto (acting chief) of Kofukuji Temple and concurrently served as an official of Hasadera Temple and Daianji Temple in Yamato Province.
